Read the other comments for specifics.
Positive:
+ Interesting story for any that don't already know it. The second game develops on it well.
+ Controls feel good and easy to grasp.
+ Upholding graphic quality for 2007.

Comments:
~ Only "issue" is the changing of difficulty during certain times in the game. Could just be my own perception, but the mid chapter missions with many, many, many turrets felt more like a dice roll than a real strategic victory. this applies to some tests and not to others, don't remember specifics.

ÐœÐ½Ðµ ÐºÐ°Ð¶ÐµÑ‚ÑÑ,Ñ‡Ñ‚Ð¾ ÑÑ‚Ð¾ Ð´Ð¾ÑÑ‚Ð°Ñ‚Ð¾Ñ‡Ð½Ð¾ Ð¸Ð½Ñ‚ÐµÑ€ÐµÑÐ½Ð°Ñ Ð³Ð¾Ð»Ð¾Ð²Ð¾Ð»Ð¾Ð¼ÐºÐ°,Ð»Ð°Ð¹Ðº

Portal is a good game!

Story: There isn't much of a story in this game, so if you like stories this game is not for you. You pretty much have to escape a facility in which you are a prisoner in.

Graphics: The game is old, so don't expect stellar graphics. But for what it is, I think the game looks good.

Sound: There is no music in this game except for the song in the credits. However, the sound of the environments and objects sound great. The voice acting is hilarious and adds charm.

Gameplay: Fairly simple. Escape the facility by going through rooms and solving puzzles which get progressively harder the further you go. You use your portal gun to loop two locations at one time to solve the puzzles or fool around.

Controls: The controls are extremely easy to learn. You move, shoot and jump. That's it!

Verdict: 7
The game is fun to play, especially when you're experimenting with the portal gun. The puzzles can get pretty hard but they are fair.  The voice that guides you throughout the game is entertaining and could possibly make you chuckle occasionally. But other than this, the game doesn't offer much. There is practically no story and no additional game modes besides puzzle solving. But for what it is, the game offers several hours of entertainment and is a unique game that everyone should try out at least once.

This game was very thrilling, I was actually screen sharing the whole time with a friend and recording a youtube video when I played it, some of the best 3 hours of strait fun and thrilling gameplay.

Its a classic, and its still pretty decent. Eaven a low-end laptop will run this game.

Great game, great story and great immersion. You really feel like playing as the character and all the secrets opens up exploration and discovery. The game concept is incredibly creative, with physics and technical possibilities being well expanded in this nostalgic, immersive and extremely well-made game. I was surprised to see myself enjoy a game like this - but the nostalgia and excitement made it worth playing for sure. The well known sequel to the game also opens up for a longer experience and they are, from my beliefs, connected in story and mechanics. 

In conclusion, a great and fun game to play for everybody. Graphics aren't bad at all and runs well on almost any system.
This game is fantastic. I recommend it for anyone who is bored on the steam store and has $10

I guess if you have a PC you have Steam and you have played this game already. It's not only a classic now but a must play. No matter which year you are in. It's a timeless game that doesvery well giving you a counsciousness about space and physiscs in a virtual world. The campaign goes by very smoothly but it's not an easy game or a particularly hard game, the answers are not always obvious, your brain will work a bit in a natural way and you'll feel rewarded for it.
